commentBody:
Belichick, The one constant.

It's not only his game-field strategies, it's his overall management - they bring in coaches and make them great coaches. They bring in players, and by great coaching, make them great players. The coaches teach, they motivate, and they bring out the best in players.

Consistently having competent/capable players is not an accident - it's great coaching in all elements (selecting players, teaching players, motivating players, and great on-field strategy and tactics), and not just by Belichick. He brings in coaches and they either learn how to be great coaches, or they're gone.

But, when the assistants go to other teams, they don't have the overall approach - elements/aspects of management/coaching they experience under Belichick they don't recognize as important and then don't duplicate, but then they don't duplicate the results.

Belichick. Reporters should ask him how he does it. He'll tell you - he loves to talk to reporters. (That last bit was sarcasm).
